violations.excerpt: name does not meet format requirements

discussion.author: orso82
discussion.text:
[noblock] IMAS is a standard data format widely used in the fusion community since 2015
* original paper: https://iopscience.iop.org/article/10.1088/0029-5515/55/12/123006
* fusion papers mentioning IMAS: https://scholar.google.com/scholar?hl=en&as_sdt=0%2C5&q=fusion+IMAS&btnG=

This is a top-level package, that uses `IMASdd.jl` and `IMASutils.jl` that have already been registered.
`IMAS.jl` gives access to the IMAS ontology in Julia and provides physics functionalities and plotting.
